body:
Thank you @sijie.

> I think this is quite similar to what @rdhabalia hit - #3633

I think so too. With @rdhabalia's modification, broker will probably be able to return to normal even if this deadlock occurs. However, I think it is ideal that this deadlock does not occur.

> #3591 is released as part of 2.3.0. it might be worth double confirming if #3591 addressed the issue here.

We have already backported #3591 to v2.2.1 and are using it. So this problem is not fixed by #3591.

No, I'm not.

> I don't think we are able to pass the checks. because the website is now built using React.

You mean it's because pages are rendered dynamically with JavaScript and the automated check doesn't find the links even if the pages have them, right? I'd be really surprised if we would not be able to put the links on our website.

I don't think making all the test results green is the real goal. The most important thing is people can access the pages from our website (the dynamically rendered pages have the URLs on there browsers).

Since the expected behavior is "All checks are green", I'm fine with closing this issue with the technical reason above, but I think we are still supposed to provide the links. I'd just edit this issue's goal.

> You mean it's because pages are rendered dynamically with JavaScript and the automated check doesn't find the links even if the pages have them, right?

Correct. Currently those links are in a dropdown menu. The dropdown menu only shows up when people clicks it. I am not sure if there are other ways to put the links on our website.

> I don't think making all the test results green is the real goal. The most important thing is people can access the pages from our website (the dynamically rendered pages have the URLs on there browsers).

Agreed. +1 from me. 

> but I think we are still supposed to provide the links.

I think all the links are correctly provided.
Thanks @ivankelly, fixed the typos and broker phrases.
@ivankelly I've applied your suggested fixes. Merging for now to get the website build started.

> even if this deadlock occurs. However, I think it is ideal that this deadlock does not occur.

@massakam, you are right. we need to figure out the root cause the issue so, it won't happen again. However, everytime I see deadlock, thread-dump showed that thread gets blocked while fetching data from zk and it happened multiple times at broker so, i don't believe that zk-client is failing this many times to return callback. However, I don't see any exception at that time which can give us evident to understand this issue. So, I feel there has to be an issue at pulsar app level rather zk-client level and I am looking into it to figure out actual root cause.

run java8 tests
run cpp tests

@aahmed-se I don't think you are using the right connector. you need to use `pulsar-io-kafka-connect-adaptor` instead of using `pulsar-io-debezium`. The documentation is here : http://pulsar.apache.org/docs/en/io-cdc/

Additionally I think debezium module should not be packaged as a NAR. it is just a normal module for keeping debezium related code changes and a dependency for `pulsar-io-kafka-connect-adaptor`.

I am running the docker image it's throwing the error

```docker run -it -p 6650:6650 -p 8080:8080 apachepulsar/pulsar-all:2.3.0 /pulsar/bin/pulsar standalone```

haven't changed anything.
It looks like a packaging issue
@aahmed-se I see. the problem is pulsar-io-debezium should not be packaged as NAR. should be a simple fix.

Also packaging and downloads are now mentioning and linking to debezium
connector.

In any case, shouldn’t that be debezium connector rather that be named
Kafka connect?
On Thu, Feb 21, 2019 at 6:46 PM Sijie Guo <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> sending a fix soon
>
> —

> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub

> the thread

> .
>
-- 
Matteo Merli
<mmerli@apache.org>

Sent pull request #3656 

> In any case, shouldn’t that be debezium connector rather that be named Kafka connect?

It is a generic kafka-connect adaptor connector that invokes debezium. because debezium is too tied to Kafka connect.

We can add a few wrappers to wrap  `kafka-connect-adaptor` to a `debezium` connector if needed. /cc @jiazhai to see if he can help with that. However I think keeping a generic `kafka-connect-adaptor` connector will have its own value.
@sijie thanks for your help @sijie @merlimat PTAL again

@eolivelli Since you are familiar with BookKeeper Kerberos auth, Would you please help review this? 
Thanks.
yes, I just tested it in my local and I did encounter the same problem.
@tuteng can you also modify the documentation for version-2.3.0 as well?

> @tuteng can you also modify the documentation for version-2.3.0 as well?

Is it edited on branch-2.3?
@sijie @merlimat Thanks for the comments. will prepare a pip for the mutual auth api changes, then back to this PR again.

It seems like the page we have for "^https?://.*apache.org/events/current-event" is the old one.
https://pulsar.apache.org/events/current-event/

I think having "/en/events" for Event page instead of "/events/current-event" is OK, but the two URLs should point to the same page.

> @tuteng it is in master: https://github.com/apache/pulsar/tree/master/site2/website/versioned_docs/version-2.3.0

@sijie Modify completed

run java8 tests
run integration tests

run integration tests
run java8 tests

> though shouldn’t that be PIP-29 instead of BP-29? ;)

You are right. Fixed :)
Can you also fix the commit log message, because that will still show up as bp on git

> Can you also fix the commit log message, because that will still show up as bp on git

we are doing squash-and-merge. the commit log message is determined at merging time. we can fix it when merging it.

To clarify, this is only ever used for AUTO_CONSUME, no? When a client passes a schema like Schema.AVRO(MyPojo.class), it won't actually know the schema version. So the schema version is only used here for the client to request a specific version of the schema from the broker?
True.. it's just that by default it still uses the commit log message and people (me included) forget to update at the squash time
Was it on Bookkeeper?  Its my company
@merlimat can you review it after the `Optional` changes.
@sijie Do you think there should be anything else?

@ivankelly that's correct. for pojo and primitive schemas, they will not know the schema version. for any other schema implementations that returns `GenericRecord`, the schema version will be used for the client to request a specific version of the schema from the broker. Currently the schema implementation returning `GenericRecord` is AUTO_CONSUME.

run cpp tests
run java8 tests
@eolivelli would you please also help look at this. Thanks.
[[pulsar-io] Support Pulsar to receive and send data from Apache NiFi ](https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/3379) is closed, so this issue can close.
[[pulsar-io] Support Pulsar to receive and send data from Apache NiFi ](https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/3379) is closed, so this issue can close.
@skyrocknroll  Would you please help provide more info about how to reproduce it?

@david-streamlio so which multiple sources/sinks packaged in a single NAR I would use the specify the classname to run a particular one? e.g.

```
./bin/pulsar-admin source create --name test --destinationTopicName output --archive foo.nar --classname my.source

```

Currently this can already be done with a JAR file, but this change is to add that support for NARs as well?

Most connectors require multiple supporting jars to be bundled with them. This allows you to submit either an Uber jar or a NAR file.

I used the pulsar-aws-nar-0.0.1.nar file for testing, which has 3 sink and 3 source connectors.

@david-streamlio this PR looks good to me, but I am unclear how the changes in the PR makes submitting a uber JAR with multiple sources/sinks different from submitting a NAR.  Do we need to support submitting with a NAR with multiple sources/sinks if submitting a uber JAR already covers the use cases of multiple sources/sinks in one package? I guess it doesn't hurt, however my concern is that we have always submitted NARs without specifying a classname since there is the a yaml file under META-INF that specifies the default source/sink classname as well as the name of the source/sink.  How does that work here?  with multiple sources and sinks.

There wouldn't be a difference between submitting an uber jar and a NAR. They would both be submitted in the exact same way. Each would require the user to specify an archive AND a classname. 

`bin/pulsar-admin source create --classname org.apache.pulsar.io.aws.sqs.SqsSource --archive /Users/david/clone-zone/streamlio/pulsar-connectors/pulsar-nar-bundles/pulsar-aws-connector-bundle/pulsar-aws-nar/target/pulsar-aws-nar-0.0.1.nar --className org.apache.pulsar.io.aws.s3.source.AwsS3Source --name s3-source --destination-topic-name s3_data --source-config-file /Users/david/Desktop/s3-config.yaml`

If no classname is specified, then the NAR is deployed as normal, i.e. the classes defined in the pulsar-io.yaml file will be used instead.

@david-streamlio so for this NAR you built, pulsar-aws-nar-0.0.1.nar,  with multiple sources and sinks, what happens if I submit this NAR without a classname? what happens? I ask since currently submitting a NAR without specifying the classname is supported and the de factor way to submit a NAR.  Does it contain a yaml file under META-INF that specifies the default source/sink classname like the rest of the sources and sinks that we currently have?

@jiazhai 3 node zookeeper , 3 nodes with broker and bookeeper servers . Once the cluster is up after clust initialize metadata executing the command will result in the error. Please Let me know if you are not able to reproduce.
@jiazhai Call to this url fails with timeout. `http://pulsar-node-1.xx.com:8080/admin/v2/non-persistent/public/default` . Call to persistent is a success.
is this issue related to this https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/3348 ?

@jerrypeng @david-streamlio - did you have any conclusions in #3576? It would be worth that you guys can conclude an approach in #3576 , so that everyone is aligned with the approach and other committers can also review it based on that approach.

update: 
just found a workaround!
if i change my code to contain the full topic path it works.
```python
consumer = pulsar_client.subscribe(re.compile('persistent://public/default/test_.*'), 'sub1')
producer = pulsar_client.create_producer('persistent://public/default/test_1')
```

I guess the doc's should at least reflect this, or even better fixing the "shorter" syntax

Each time a broker hung, one thread named `ForkJoinPool.commonPool-worker-x` always stopped in the following state:
```

   java.lang.Thread.State: BLOCKED (on object monitor)

	- waiting to lock <0x00007f6373bd6600> (a org.apache.pulsar.broker.service.persistent.PersistentSubscription)

	at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.postComplete(CompletableFuture.java:474)
	at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.complete(CompletableFuture.java:1962)
	at org.apache.pulsar.zookeeper.ZooKeeperDataCache.lambda$0(ZooKeeperDataCache.java:66)

This thread seems to be related to the processing of ZK cache. Could this be the cause of this problem?
@ofaz was able to reproduce the error with a python pulsar client but everything works fine with the java pulsar client.  Will investigate further.

The source exception is actually the following which causes the split to close and the exceptions in the close method

```
